title: The Human Anatomy in Paris
description: This course will introduce students to the internal structure of the human body with the addition of visits to museum collections held in Paris, the place where the most famous French surgeons-anatomists paved the way to all the eponyms used in surgery. Program or materials fees may apply. Students will not receive credit for both ANBI 144GS and ANBI 144. Prerequisites: upper-division standing. Students must submit applications to the Global Initiatives Study Abroad Office and be accepted into the Global Seminar Program.
